content.raw:
It is currently not in Ubuntu.

For my current work, I created a vendor package: [https://github.com/mjcarroll/remotery\_vendor](https://github.com/mjcarroll/remotery_vendor) that I just clone in my colcon workspace.  Since it’s a static library and headers, we could potentially generate a package off of that.

As you said, the alternative would be to bring the entire dep into the ignition-common repo.  It’s pretty lightweight \(a c file, a header file, and the visualization webpage\).
content.html:
It is currently not in Ubuntu.

For my current work, I created a vendor package: https://github.com/mjcarroll/remotery_vendor that I just clone in my colcon workspace. Since it’s a static library and headers, we could potentially generate a package off of that.

As you said, the alternative would be to bring the entire dep into the ignition-common repo. It’s pretty lightweight (a c file, a header file, and the visualization webpage).
